Package paintingcanvas

Class App.AnimationBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • paintingcanvas.App.AnimationBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Animatable
    Enclosing class:
    App
    public static class App.AnimationBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
implements Animatable
    A builder used to add animations to an element. 
    
 Text text = new Text(100, 100, "Hello World");
 text.animate()
     .add(moveTo(200, 200), 3);

      • schedule

        public static void schedule​(double time,
                            Event.EventRunner runner,
                            TimeUnit unit,
                            boolean repeat)
        Schedule the execution of arbitrary code with a Event.EventRunner at an absolute time. 
        
 // Print 'hi' after 10 seconds
 AnimationBuilder.schedule(10, c -> System.out.println("hi"), TimeUnit.Seconds, false);
        Parameters:
        time - The time from the start of the program to the start of the animation
        runner - The Event.EventRunner object
        unit - The TimeUnit used for time
        repeat - If the event should repeat

      • schedule

        public static void schedule​(double time,
                            boolean repeat,
                            Event.EventRunner runner)
        Schedule the execution of arbitrary code with a Event.EventRunner at an absolute time. 
        
 // Print 'hi' after 10 seconds
 AnimationBuilder.schedule(10, c -> System.out.println("hi"), TimeUnit.Seconds, false);
        Parameters:
        time - The time in seconds from the start of the program to the start of the animation
        repeat - If the event should repeat
        runner - The Event.EventRunner object

      • add

        public App.AnimationBuilder add​(Animation animation,
                                double duration,
                                TimeUnit unit)
        Add a new animation to the element. 
        
 // these animations will run one after the other
 obj.animate()
    .add(moveTo(100, 100), 100, TimeUnit.Frames)
    .add(colorTo(Color.BLUE), 100, TimeUnit.Frames);
        Parameters:
        animation - The animation type to add
        duration - The amount of time the animation will last
        unit - The unit of time used for duration
        Returns:
        this to allow method chaining

      • add

        public App.AnimationBuilder add​(Animation animation,
                                double duration)
        Add a new animation to the element. 
        
 // these animations will run one after the other
 obj.animate()
    .add(moveTo(100, 100), 10)
    .add(colorTo(Color.BLUE), 10);
        Parameters:
        animation - The animation type to add
        duration - The amount of time the animation will last. In seconds.
        Returns:
        this to allow method chaining

      • with

        public App.AnimationBuilder with​(Animation animation,
                                 double duration,
                                 TimeUnit unit)
        Add the animation alongside / with the previous animation. 
        
 // these animations will run at the same time
 obj.animate()
    .add(moveTo(100, 100), 100, TimeUnit.Frames)
    .add(colorTo(Color.BLUE), 100, TimeUnit.Frames);
        Parameters:
        animation - The animation type to add
        duration - The amount of time the animation will last
        unit - The unit of time used for duration
        Returns:
        this to allow method chaining

      • wait

        public App.AnimationBuilder wait​(double duration,
                                 TimeUnit unit)
        Used to add delays between animations. 
        
 // the second animation will run 50 frames after the first one finishes
 obj.animate()
    .add(moveTo(100, 100), 100)
    .wait(50, TimeUnit.Frames)
    .add(colorTo(Color.BLUE), 100);

 // the second animation will run 50 frames after the first one starts
 obj.animate()
    .add(moveTo(100, 100), 100)
    .wait(50, TimeUnit.Frames)
    .with(colorTo(Color.BLUE), 100);
        Parameters:
        duration - Time to wait
        unit - The TimeUnit to use for the duration
        Returns:
        this to allow method chaining

      • wait

        public App.AnimationBuilder wait​(double duration)
        Used to add delays between animations. 
        
 // the second animation will run 10 seconds after the first one finishes
 obj.animate()
    .add(moveTo(100, 100), 100)
    .wait(10)
    .add(colorTo(Color.BLUE), 100);

 // the second animation will run 10 seconds after the first one starts
 obj.animate()
    .add(moveTo(100, 100), 100)
    .wait(10)
    .with(colorTo(Color.BLUE), 100);
        Parameters:
        duration - Frames to wait
        Returns:
        this to allow method chaining

      • wait

        public App.AnimationBuilder wait​(int duration)
        Used to add delays between animations. 
        
 // the second animation will run 10 seconds after the first one finishes
 obj.animate()
    .add(moveTo(100, 100), 100)
    .wait(10)
    .add(colorTo(Color.BLUE), 100);

 // the second animation will run 10 seconds after the first one starts
 obj.animate()
    .add(moveTo(100, 100), 100)
    .wait(10)
    .with(colorTo(Color.BLUE), 100);
        Parameters:
        duration - Frames to wait
        Returns:
        this to allow method chaining

      • schedule

        public App.AnimationBuilder schedule​(double time,
                                     Animation animation,
                                     double duration,
                                     TimeUnit unit)
        Schedule an Animation at an absolute time. 
        
 // obj will start moving to (100, 100) 20 frames after the program starts
 obj.animate()
    .schedule(20, moveTo(100, 100), 10, TimeUnit.Frames);
        Parameters:
        time - The time from the start of the program to the start of the animation
        animation - The Animation to execute
        duration - The length of the animation
        unit - The TimeUnit used for time and duration
        Returns:
        The original object to allow method chaining

      • schedule

        public App.AnimationBuilder schedule​(double time,
                                     Animation animation,
                                     double duration)
        Schedule an Animation at an absolute time. 
        
 // obj will start moving to (100, 100) 10 seconds after the program starts
 obj.animate()
    .schedule(10, moveTo(100, 100), 5);
        Parameters:
        time - The time from the start of the program to the start of the animation. In seconds.
        animation - The Animation to execute
        duration - The length of the animation. In seconds.
        Returns:
        The original object to allow method chaining

      • animate

        public App.AnimationBuilder animate()
        Description copied from interface: Animatable
        Create an App.AnimationBuilder. Used to animate different properties of an element (position, rotation, color). 
        
 Circle o = new Circle(100, 100, 20);

 // Animate Circle o to move to 200, 200 for 3 seconds
 o.animate().add(moveTo(200, 200), 3);
        Specified by:
        animate in interface Animatable
        Returns:
        App.AnimationBuilder
